page.title: 20WOKINGHAM - ECONOMICS
page.content: There are a number of financial institutions in Wokingham which are mainly concentrated in Broad Street. Wokingham has branches of the five main banks. There are 11{accountants,} 11{building societies,}4 insurance brokers and 1 mortgage broker. For 1984-5{rates}per pound were 158.3p paid directly to{Wokingham {District Council}which kept 7%. The County Council received 91% and the Parish Councils about 2%. For each Â£1 of the rates 59p went on{education,}9p on social services; transport 8p and the remaining 24p divided between 14 essential services. These pages on Wokingham have been researched and written by: Embrook Junior School Wokingham The Holt School Wokingham The Palmer Junior School Wokingham { } Wescott County School Wokingham
